website_summaries.verdict: A less expensive option with many of the same convenient features.
pros: Waterproof PVC semi-coated mesh gives it durability
Comes with straps to use on a roof rack and also car clips to use without a rack
Protective flaps cover zippers with Velcro closures to keep water from seeping in
cons: Specifically sized for sedans, wagons, and crossovers

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great for my 16 hrs(2-Way) drive to Disney World
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great for my 16 hrs(2-Way) drive to Disney World. It rained several times, and luggage didn't get wet. Initially one strap came a loose, but I fixed this issue by double wrapping access strap around the empty loop holder that sits right beside it. No other issues. I filled the bag completely to prevent any sliding issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Everything gets wet with light rain imagine what would happen if I hit slot of rain...😡
customer_reviews.text: It’s loaded everything nicely fit everything nicely strapped to the top of my vehicle nicely we had some light rain on the trip and when we got there everything was wet . And it’s sold it on saying it was a weather resistant carrier we didn’t even hit bad weather and I had to do all my laundry again it’s soaked up all the water and all my boxes were wet and had to be transferred into new boxes not very happy with this product even though it looks nice and clips on easy. The protection is definitely not there when we hit very little weather and it affected our stuff so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds a LOT of gear, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I used this to bring camping gear on a 3 hour drive. It was very easy to install. I recommend packing it on the ground so you can see what fits and how to arrange it. Then empty it, put it on top of the car and re-pack it. It held up fine, no tears, no problems with zippers. It seems well made. It held the following: 3 sleeping bags 3 twin air mattresses 3 camping chairs 1 -12 person tent 1 -4 person tent 6 large towels 3 large blankets 2 air pumps 1 bag of beach toys
customer_reviews.author: Astra E. Woodcraft

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from a month long road trip where this thing held out applicably and I was all set to give a 5 star review. I kept all of my camping supplies in it as I drove cross country. Until, the very end of my trip, I drove through some pretty heavy rain most of the day. The next day, when I unzipped the bag to get everything out, there was standing water in the bag and everything in it had to come out and dry out. Everything about this bag was great until that. It. sucked.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist you money
customer_reviews.text: Was just okay. Depending on how you installed it, you may or may not get road noise. We drove from Kansas to Oregon and back but my husband was to scared to use it until we hit Oregon. It worked good for a while but on the last day to day and a half it started falling apart. We got some gorilla tape and taped it every stop and limped home. But it went strait in the trash. We used it with a 2017 Honda Civic hatchback.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAndTrue

customer_reviews.title: Not strong. Reduces MPG significantly
customer_reviews.text: The material ended up torn up after one 6 hour drive. It didn’t hold up well and the straps were pretty annoyingly loud. Having it on reduced my gas mileage from 50 mpg to 24 mpg. Cut my mileage in half. I think I’ll get a hard version or something to tow instead
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Pare

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and large capacity. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our family beach trip and it was perfect! I have a Mazda 3 2016 hatchback and it fit perfectly on top, even though this one is recommended for SUVs it still fits on smaller vehicles just fine. We were able to fit 2 medium suitcases, 2 large duffel bags, beach towels and toys, 11 grocery bags full of groceries, 2 book bags, a large laundry bag and a few smaller items! We only had to put our cooler in my trunk. We drove over 200 miles and no issues at all. I absolutely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: #HPlover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something quick and easy for a trip, this worked out very good. Went through rain and snow and everything stayed dry as promised. Get the pad for underneath and cut the corners smaller than what you think is needed or the noise will make you crazy. Holds a lot of stuff, I packed mine on the ground and hoisted it up on top of the car, not easy but you can pack a lot into it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased this item back in July 2017 and were pleased with it until recently
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item back in July 2017 and were pleased with it until recently. As our family was making a weekend trip, we packed the bag and as we were traveling down the highway our bag fell off. Our personal items all over the highway. The bag was absolutely destroyed. Why is there not a safety harness or restraint that fastens to the vehicle for something like this? Someone could have seriously got hurt. Due to this, we will no longer purchase a product of this kind until something like this is added. Our family lost $500 in this. The items retrieved were not salvageable.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this carrier for a 2016 Mitsubishi Outlander and let me just say that it held tremendously for a 1200 mile trip. This bag went through thunderstorms and intense heat without any problems. I don't know if it helps but we did put all of the heavier items towards the front of the carrier and of course the lightweight towards the back and didn't use any extra tie downs or tarps the tie downs that came with the carrier worked perfectly but never once broke but we did constantly check the carrier every stop. We also used a rubber mat under the carrier which kept it from moving at all
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Rubio

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not give this a 5 star was for the straps. They worked well once I figured out how to put them on. A previous topper I owned had the straps attached to the carrier itself. These are separate and I constantly was worrying about losing them before our move. I have them zipped inside the carrier now, but still don't like that they aren't permanently attached!
customer_reviews.author: Msgtdeb

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth it!!! I was able to fit so much into this car topper. We drove all the way from Cali to WA with no issues. Very import fill it up and make sure you tie the loose ends of the straps so they don’t flap. Easy to install and take off for hotel stops during your trip. Buy the anti slip mat suggested it will keep bag from moving or scarching car!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Don't use without a roof rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a KIA 2016 soul and a Nissan Rogue 2012. We don't have roof racks and tried to use the straps to fasten them like the website suggested. As soon as you hit over 40 mph all we heard was loud whistling because the doors don't fully close. We turned around and went home, tossed em off the car. What a waste of money .
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CARRIER! RECOMMEND HIGHLY!
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier! I have a Toyota Corolla & it fits great. We were able to take what we needed on a trip. 1st time having one of these. It seems to hold up really well. If you hear noises, you just need to adjust the straps a little. Make sure your straps are tucked in so they don't flap in the wind. That will make noises if you don't. Easy to travel with. Recommend Highly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Road trip from Oregon to Montana and back again, no trouble!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't run into rain so I can't attest to it's weatherproofing, but it worked on my 2006 Scion XA for that added space we needed for our return trip (going through family heirlooms to take back after preparing my grandmother's home for sale). Straps got a bit loose once on the return, but overall well worth the extra legroom in such a small car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 1/2 hours
customer_reviews.text: After 5 1/2 hours into our first trip with the bag, the rear driver side attachment straps broke off, this resulted in the bag coming unzipped. Luckily, I heard this right away and was able to pull our vehicle over without losing any luggage. As I was pulled over a good semaritan stopped and gave me a ratchet strap to use in order to secure our luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Alan melies

customer_reviews.title: Good for price.
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to install. For roof installation: Needs to be packed w/ heaviest items in front- if not carrier will lift and shift after highway driving- due to air flow. Recommend tiring excess straps up to offer another security measure. Hooks easily mounted- do pull on door seal a bit but no damage done.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.  Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Wery well made. Heavy duty and waterproof if you follow manufacturer instructions. We were rained on the entirety of our 4 hour trip and nothing got wet. The straps did not loosen. It worked as described. There is an extra velcro closure over the the zipper to ensure there is no leakage. I compared quite a few roof bags before I bought this one and I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NonnieV

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Rain snow huge winds blowing us all over the road our car top carrier made it just fine driving over the Great Divide. I would recommend this carrier any time! We got a very small amount of water at the rear of the of the unit but it was not zipped tightly enough. Follow instructions. You CAN put stuff in the sides between the rails (extra tie-downs).
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The bag is great at first
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rooftop bag in February. My wife and I used it in a relocation trip from NYC to Seattle. The bag is great at first. However, on the third day of our trip, the strap is damaged, started fraying. However, we contacted customer service, and we are just asking the replacement for the strap, but they refunded entire purchase to us! They are very kind. If you are driving, make sure you put the strap in right angle. Otherwise, you will hear too much noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jingwei He

customer_reviews.title: Worked well in a short but hot drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on top of my Kia Souls’ roof rack and it worked pretty well. I placed blankets, sleeping bags and pillows in there. I did not encounter rain but I did encounter a few hours of heat and it held up. I only drove for a short 3hr drive but 10 miles of it were rugged terrain and the items inside the bag stayed clean. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did the job, but not very well.
customer_reviews.text: I was not very pleased with this product. It started to split in one of the corners the first time using it. We made a trip from Virginia to Michigan and although our items stayed dry (there was a bit of rain), we had to keep stopping do to the straps coming loose. We following the included instructions on properly tying it down, however, they continued to loosen. We did not fill the bag, which could have been part of the issue as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Needs reinforcement to hold it on the car
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to help move our daughter from California to Colorado. Within no time my husband had to use his surf rack straps To keep it on the car. It would work better if the straps connected all the way through the inside of the car. The big plus is, it can hold a lot. Because we have the surf straps, we’re pretty happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Drove 1000 miles with it on top of our vehicle with no issues. Right about the 1100 mile mark the straps snapped and the luggage carrier flew off of our van at 75 miles per hour. I stopped and before I could do anything a truck smashed right through it obliterating our luggage. Over $500 worth of luggage, the carrier, hygiene items, and clothes were destroyed. I am very disappointed that the item failed and cost me so much money. Please spend your money on something else.
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: We went from Hampton, VA to Dallas, TX in cold, rainy weather, it held a family of 8 clothing items and few Christmas gifts. Easy to put together, easy to clean, pack, held against wind, rain, attached easily to roof rack. Would recommend and extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my car's luggage rack for a cross country move. It went through snow and rain without any issues. This is a great bag. I added a lock to the zipper with a wireless movement alarm in the bag since I didn't unload on the evenings we stopped for the night. It's a great bag and does it's job well. I can't say much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Decent Performance
customer_reviews.text: Used it for approx. 1200 miles, with about 50 through light rain. Small leak via zipper. No internal accumulation of water, just a small wet spot on a shoe. Had it been a torrential downpour at interstate speeds, it might have been worse. Solidly built, and the provided strap system was more than adequate. All in all, money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: GlassMage

customer_reviews.title: water proof
customer_reviews.text: We put this on top of my daughter's Honda Civic. We had minor difficulties understanding how to attach the hooks to the inside of the car because there was not a roof rack, but we looked up a video on YouTube and it worked. In July, she moved from Florida to Wisconsin. We put her clothes in the carrier. During the brutal heat of Florida Summer the black bag was hot to the touch, but once zipped up the clothes stayed dry during the midday rain downpours. On the highway driving 70mph the bag was tight and secure. The carrier worked exactly how we wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Check Rightline’s website for compatibility with your vehicle, don’t trust Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Product was totally mis-marketed. Amazon’s website said this would fit my car (a 2017 Ford Edge) but it absolutely did not. When I looked it up on Rightline’s website, their site said it was NOT suitable for the Ford Edge.... I never put it on, sent it back right away. Bad job, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Carkus

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. We used it for a road trip from Colorado to Michigan and it only lasted one way before the seam tore. We didn't even trust it enough for the ride home and ended up fitting whatever we had in it, into the car for the ride home. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works well; be sure to fill it up so no part flaps.
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well for us on top of our smallish Nissan Versa when we moved from the San Diego Area to Newark, CA. Just be sure to fill it completely so that there is no flapping with the wind, because, as others have noted, aerodynamic flutter will tear it apart. First load suitcases, boxes, and bags, and then stuff any empty parts with individual pieces of clothing. If you can only fill it partially, be sure to strap down any empty portions. We used the straps to attach to the door sills, which made for significant wind noise above 65 MPH because of the slight displacement of the top of the door frames.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S. Wenzel

customer_reviews.title: not perfect, but useful
customer_reviews.text: Not rainproof, some of our gear was wet when we unloaded after driving all day, however it was sturdy and easy to assemble. The straps seemed to be adjusted well but we heard flapping about 5 hours into our drive and pulled over to find that they had come undone completely on 2 sides. I used duct tape to secure them and there were no issues after that. So, don't put anything in this that can't handle a little moisture, and bring a roll of duct tape with you just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Weidner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR TRAVELING
customer_reviews.text: We needed more room and this was perfect to get the extra space we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: For a cross country trip, recently, that took four days: I wrapped plastic around it after securing it to the rack with the straps according to the instructions and used mailing tape to secure the plastic around it. I drove cross country through Kansas and other states during the recent extremely heavy rain and hail. The plastic tore, but the carrier remained secure with everything inside completely dry. Bugs seem to not stick to it. It is a good carrier. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Vadenev

customer_reviews.title: Did great on a long trip and thru the rain.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to move from NH to SC, hit rain several times, everything stayed dry. Was able to put a lock on it to connect the two zippers. Glad we had it! Needed the extra space for sure.
customer_reviews.author: ShinedownAddict

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Did a 20 hr move from Los Angeles to Austin Texas and bought two for the trip!! They're solid it rained and nothing got ruined. I bought other straps because the ones that come with the bag are not compatible with my car. The straps I bought wrapped around the entire roof.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar13

customer_reviews.title: Worked beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how it would work, but it did, wonderfully. I have a 2005 Prius. It attached easily, didn't mark up the car and went 600 miles (partially in rain) with no problem. I cut a cheap yoga mat in half and put that as a layer between the bag and car. Don't know if it needed it or helped, but there were no scratches at the end. Saw another one on the road while we were traveling. What a great alternative to a permanent rack. I used it with the clips to the frame as I don't have a roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: jessica.r.mowry

customer_reviews.title: One way great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for one way trip to Houston from NC in winter. Worked great no problems. Bag was not completely full and it did rain on trip but all stayed dry bag looks like it could make another trip if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Does what it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! It wasn’t load to us. The straps did keep loosening and we had to adjust 2-3 times in a 600 mile trip. But we don’t have rails. Very sturdy. Feet room for passengers!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Kept our gear clean and dry
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a trip in a roof rack basket. It worked great and kept our gear dry and clean. We drove through several rain showers and had no issue with moisture getting in the bag. We always made certain the flap was pulled over the zipper and velcroed down.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Student

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone. We went from Louisville to Gatlinburg hitting 70-80 mph without issues and I didn't even notice a big chance in gas mileage.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for my wife’s road trip from Charlotte NC to LI New York. Fit a medium size and small size suit case, infant toys and still had room for a ton more. Bag held up, no rips or tears. I used an extra strap across the middle because bag wasn’t 100% full. Strongly suggest if you have no roof rack system.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very upset. making a trip 1/2 way accross coumtry and 1 hr into the trip a strap broke off! Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.E.

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The size is good and it attached easily and securely to the top of our vehicle. The issue with this product is that it is NOT waterproof. We drove approximately 9 hours over 2 days and encountered several heavy thunderstorms along the way. Our belongings were damp and smelled of mildew when we unpacked at our final destination. We had to throw away a few items due to this. I wouldn’t recommend this product or use it again due to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: My nissan livina jas no roof rails nor carriers but the product worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit together with Rightline non-skid pad and used them for our family trip to the northern part of the Philippines (Baguio). Baguio city is 5k feet plus above sea level and with steep and challenging bends and zig-zag roads and steep inclines. Hauled two 15 kilo bags and other materials. My nissan livina jas no roof rails nor carriers but the product worked like a charm. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Luisito Enrile

customer_reviews.title: Great price.  Sturdy. Good directions
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the soft side cartop carrier. Met every need we had, and it stayed in place then folded away easily when empty. Very easy to return to the box it was shipped in for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy all the way around. Have only used it once, but still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Caudle

customer_reviews.title: So sturdy, but without roof racks it has to go ...
customer_reviews.text: So sturdy, but without roof racks it has to go into the window or car door which when it rains allows for leaking into the car. Other than that though tis great. Fits TONS of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Harding

customer_reviews.title: Good item for the money
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for two trips now and it has held up pretty good. I haven’t used it through rain, but no dust or anything came into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lili M

customer_reviews.title: On the small side
customer_reviews.text: The bag is on the small size, but did the job for holding our luggage when we went on a camping trip. I would not put heavy items in this bag, we put our gear in the back of the car. I have a Ford Flex and it looked pretty tiny on the top. Look at the demensions first before purchasing this item, it might not be big enough for your needs. We didn't have any problems installing it onto the car. It didn't come with window clamps so we jimmy-rigged it to tie through the car since we don't have a luggage rack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine, granted I bought it used but when I purchased the item it clearly stated that all parts were included. Including he straps and clips, however when we received the car carrier only one strap and clip were included so now we have spent another 35 dollars to buy what we need to use it when we could have just bought a brand new one for 55 dollars. Kind of a rip off, definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jaquelynn

customer_reviews.title: Used once, ripped. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I used this once, driving from Ohio to Florida. I packed it as specified and it was a perfect on the way to Florida. The return was a different story. The bag ripped 400 miles into my trip. We unpacked it, taped it as best I could, turned it around and repacked it. Stopped another 400 miles I to the trip and the bag had ripped again. Complete waste of money. The product does not last for more then a one time use.
customer_reviews.author: Alma Readinger

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my move from PA to TX. Super easy to install on top of my Jeep Compass and didn't budge/shift during the long drive. I vacuum sealed all my clothes and was able to fit it all in, plus a few pairs of shoes. It kept everything dry, even though I drove through a lot of rain. Would've been nice if it came with a bag for storage, but definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Morales

customer_reviews.title: Small and noisy
customer_reviews.text: Used it only once by now, in dry weather, so have no idea regarding waterproof. The material looks good and protective. Pros: Very easy installation, takes a little space when not in use Cons: A bit smaller then expected There is a lot of noise from the wind during riding, which does not exist w/o the bag. Could not make it disappear even after few attempts.
customer_reviews.author: From Israel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for us.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize when we first packed it that it had a small hole in it. It came that way. So the bag leaked lucky I had packed all our stuff in the XL ziplock bags. I don't have a rack on top of my car and the straps made my door seals leak rain. On the way home the bag got a small hole in it and the weather proof lining rubbed off. I won't ever buy this bag again. It did get my stuff from Oklahoma to Florida and back but not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alvina Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great cargo carrier with lots of room!
customer_reviews.text: We used this on our Honda Pilot to travel across Colorado and it worked very well. I STRONGLY recommend giving the strap a twist before securing it to your vehicle to keep the straps from vibrating and sounding like giant killer bees on your rooftop. The twist in the strap makes it aerodynamic and the buzz will completely go away. We packed everything we need for our family of 5 in this carrier for a weeks worth of travel. Great purchase! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Giant Dog Paws

customer_reviews.title: Works 👍 FYI leave the mother in law home
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the two times i used it. No issues with it so far. 3 hour ride to the beach. My mother in law was very nervous with her bag being on the roof(her clothes and ipad were in there). It started to downpour. Everything was fine and dry. I should have bought earplugs for the ride though.
customer_reviews.author: Baxinc

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but NOT waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I actually really did like the product, but if you absolutely need it to be waterproof don’t buy this. The flap around the zipper got folded up going 75+ mph on the highway and when it rained, the rain got right thru the zipper. Thankfully nothing was damaged, but this product has great durability and no concern for the goods to fall off while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Leaked on day one
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it rained don’t know what is wrong with companies making poor quality stuff ...
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof but don’t recommend if you don’t have a luggage rack
customer_reviews.text: Used the carrier without a luggage rack and 1 hour into the trip the straps completely broke off on one side. Had to stop and buy straps in order to keep the luggage on top of the roof. It rained for a few hours and everything stayed completely dry so I’m happy at least that worked.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Went about 450 miles and the front Corners started to tear open and the straps where they connect on the top of the bag started to rip. I had to clip the straps into the door molding because I have no roof rack and I did not like how the clips dug into the molding. Also the straps left black marks on my SUV because it's white. I would have tooken pictures but I was so disappointed and I already returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: Great way to expand your cargo capacity
customer_reviews.text: We use this for a recent camping trip. It held up really well to all of the random shapes that we shoved inside of it and was easy to install on top of the car. I can’t speak to mileage since I’ve only used it for the one trip but it did great for to 5 Hour drives back-and-forth
customer_reviews.author: Erin Brown

customer_reviews.title: I Would recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.text: Family of 7 in a minivan 150+ miles Used a non slip mat under just because of other recommendations and it didn't budge. We used duffel bags with no hard edges to pack our stuff then loaded them into this bag once it was on the roof. (No suitcases or coolers) Bag did its job and we will use it again. It rained one night and the contents did not get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package for our Thanksgiving road trip and 2 of the seams were totally ripped out and the back has wear lines that look like they will not keep out water. It’s too late to return. Should have examined it when I got it. Dirty pool Amazon, I have never had a prime order this bad before. Cosmetic damage my foot!
customer_reviews.author: Juliette Cutts

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cargo carrier! The size is actually deceiving, it holds alot! We used it for a camping trip two hours away via highway, and it didn't move an inch.
customer_reviews.author: JJett

customer_reviews.title: Durable and definitely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I drove from FL to NY with this carrier. It rained a lot! Nothing inside got wet nor did it open up throughout the drive. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely purchase this again!
customer_reviews.text: I fit a lot in this! It was super easy to attach (I'm a single mom who tent camps with the kiddo and puppy!) I would definitely purchase again !
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Kulpa

customer_reviews.title: Small tear after a couple hundred miles
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious product. Fit 4 large camping backpacks in it with room to spare. Sadly after a couple hundred miles there was a tear along one of the corners so we had to turn the bag around to prevent further ripping. Not a huge deal and it has held up perfectly ever since but a bit disappointed it tore so early into the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: extra room!
customer_reviews.text: very good product , needed more room in suv so this worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: david lund

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Traveled from Hampton Roads VA, to West Haven, CT. Product was exactly what I hoped it would be. A little noisy, but withstood thunderstorms, and high winds
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: I was very impressed by the sturdy fabric and so the zippers
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by the sturdy fabric and so the zippers....was a little disappointed that the straps will not be enough for minivans without racks as advertised. As for holding up for the road trip, I don't know yet, can let you know in a couple of weeks.updating my first review ......found that water resistant doesn't really mean anything...took my trip, it rained during the trip, got to destination, 5 inches of water in the INSIDE of the carrier!!!!! Apparently this carrier won't keep the water out but will keep it in!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase for our family travels
customer_reviews.text: This product was a great purchase for Yukon. Traveling with kids, space is a premium. This product allowed us to store luggage on the roof and allow for more space which equaled less annoyance. Through interstate travel and rain, everything stayed safe and in place!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Product reliably.
customer_reviews.text: This product I don't care what people have to say about it is amazing the straps will hold no matter what as long as they are secured properly. This product was recently in a single car rollover and never came off of the vehicle nor did it tear. Amazing product I would 100000000000000000000% recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fordem

customer_reviews.title: It really works great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my move from California to Florida! I did add two front tie down straps for extra safety and piece of mind! My average speed with it on top of my BMW 540i was 85 MPH average 19 mpg!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. DIAS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a trip
customer_reviews.text: Just what I asked for, even came early in the day!
customer_reviews.author: Danisha Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke mid travel
customer_reviews.text: 1.5 hours driving and a strap broke. Also our package did not come with door hooks. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Vai

customer_reviews.title: Great rooftop carrier if you don't have bars to strap onto
customer_reviews.text: Drove from Illinois to Arizona with this! And it held up great! Went through a few storms also and nothing got wet! Great buy! But just a heads up if your driving long distance, every 2hours or so you should check the straps because they sometimes get loose and need to be tightened.
customer_reviews.author: victoria petitte

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is poor quality. Receive this on a Thursday and took it to a 900 miles trip on Friday. When arrive to destination founded that the materials have started to rip and the black outer layer is starting to wore out exposing the white interior.
customer_reviews.author: Huy Bui

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag on a recent camping trip and it held a lot of stuff. I have a 2012 Sienna with multiple kids so I needed the extra space and it did not disappoint. The bag is made very well and once it was tied down, felt very secure on my roof rack. Would def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Youkeun Oh

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra straps!
customer_reviews.text: The canvas is heavy duty and held everything we needed, but the straps broke rather easily as we were tightening it down. Had to buy additional straps but otherwise, the carrier is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: BethS

customer_reviews.title: Kept items dry, very secure.
customer_reviews.text: Used a few times with no issues. Most recently drove 5 hours in intermittent pouring rain, and all contents were dry inside upon arrival. Strapped securely to roof rack, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: This product is not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: This product says it's water proof but it is not we drove from New Jersey to Florida and it rained real hard and when wet got to the hotel the suitcases and some of the clothes inside the suitcases were wet. If I could get my money back I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I need to send it back
customer_reviews.text: Despite promises it would fit, it did not install on my Nissan 2009.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Edgar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: and easy to load and unload
customer_reviews.text: It is big, roomy, and easy to load and unload. I suggest that you purchase the pad to protect the top of the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Sharding

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: Used for vacation held alot of stuff. Tip put the zipper in the rear facing the back so you don't hear the while sound.
customer_reviews.author: kristina masi

customer_reviews.title: Great item would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item worked well for me on a 300 mile trip make sure the zipper is faxed towards the back
customer_reviews.author: R Martinez

customer_reviews.title: LONG DISTANCE FAILURE
customer_reviews.text: Drove from Brooklyn, NY to Fla and it was perfect. Stopped in Virginia to rest on the way back and noticed that the front right corner, split open. It rained so I hope my luggage didn't get ruined. Don't buy it for long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Pete

customer_reviews.title: This bag was amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag was amazing!!! Its completely weather proof and hugh. I used it with out the roof rack it stayed perfectly still my entire 5hr trip. Then someone stole it 😕 so I will be buying another !
customer_reviews.author: mellymel3

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction - short return window
customer_reviews.text: Bought well in advance of our trip - put just a few items in it ( outdoor chairs) was not overloaded at all and ripped open on the seam on second day of use. return window is only 3 weeks so unable to return - do not purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrading my review
customer_reviews.text: Amending this review to a better rating. we’ve got the hang of it and have used this for several trips. Directions were unclear
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Montevirgen

customer_reviews.title: In hindsight we should have gotten the hard shell roof ...
customer_reviews.text: In hindsight we should have gotten the hard shell roof carrier. You cannot have any hard or sharp edges, or they will put holes in the bag. You also need to pack it full to max. If bag is loose(any flapping) the wind will beat weatherproofing off the inside. No door clips so straps go through the car. Inconvenient, especially on long trips. We went with soft so we could put in the trunk when not being used and easier storage.
customer_reviews.author: JulieP

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Held more than I thought it would and was easy to secure. Didn’t have a single problem during travel at highway speeds.
customer_reviews.author: KillaChap

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product, could not be more pleased
customer_reviews.text: This item saved our family vacation! Had a hard case but it was stolen and did not know how we were going to get luggage for all 5 kids plus ourselves in the minivan...this held all the kids luggage plus the packnplay and it totally down poured on us on the way home but everything stayed dry...wonderful product, could not be more pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Calder

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a single trip. Damaged our luggage.
customer_reviews.text: In a single trip, the straps pulled off the bag, exposing our luggage. Our suitcases were also damaged from the resulting exposure. We were fortunate to have not lost anything.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin L. Walling

customer_reviews.title: Twist all straps before secure to vehicle,  because straps make noise when driving.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for long trip traveling, and save lots of space in vehicles, but have to fill it first on ground , then you need tw0 people to lift it on roof .
customer_reviews.author: John Kardosz

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: We traveled about 1500 miles with this strapped to the top of our Hyundai Elantra. Worked like a charm. We went through mountains, high wind, and heavy rain. This product did not budge, nor did anything inside get wet. I bought one of the non skid rug pads from walmart, and had that underneath the bag, so it didnt move.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant: yes Weatherproof: no Drove through the midwest in winter, snow froze on the bag and seeped into the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag. Held lots of stuff. Easy on and off
customer_reviews.author: Wyosmith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. It held up great on our trip. We packed it tight and had no issues. Worked perfectly on our multi-state trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Used to hold lots of luggage on 10 day trip through Germany and Austria. Hard rain, drove up to 140mph on Autobahn, no problems whatsoever. Bags were completely safe and dry! Easy to mount, easy to remove!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

product_meta.title: Rightline Gear Ace 2 Car Top Carrier, 15 cu ft, Weatherproof, Attaches With or Without Roof Rack
product_meta.description: Size:15 cu ft - w/ or w/o roof rackEnhance your cargo space with the Rightline Gear Ace 2 Car Top Carrier. Designed for use WITH or WITHOUT a roof rack, you can attach the carrier's straps to a vehicle's roof rack or use the Car Clips to attach the straps to a vehicle's door frame weather molding - the only revolutionary solution of its kind that WILL NOT interfere with passenger headroom. Rated Weatherproof, the Ace 2's UV protected PVC Semi-Coated Mesh shell, welded seams, and protective zipper flap provide a durable barrier from the elements. With 15 cubic feet of rooftop storage, you can transport your cargo and your passengers without compromising safety, comfort, or convenience. All Right line Gear products come backed by a 1 year manufacturer's warranty, so Gear up with confidence! Spend less time dealing with overpriced and overcomplicated alternatives, and more time doing what you love with a Rightline Gear Car Top Carrier.
feature_bullets: QUALITY WEATHERPROOF CONSTRUCTION: Engineered welded seams + hook-&-loop-close zipper flap provide reinforced protection against rain, snow, heat, heavy winds, and other extreme conditions.
1 YEAR MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY: Shop confidently; our service team is based in the USA & skillfully trained to help you with any questions or concerns.
ATTACHES WITH OR WITHOUT A ROOF RACK: Attach the carrier's straps to a vehicle’s roof rack or use the Car Clips to attach the straps to a vehicle's door frame weather molding.
LARGE CAPACITY DESIGN: 15 cubic feet of storage, 44” L x 34” W x 17” H; designed for SUVs, minivans, and crossovers. Perfect for moving and vacations!
EASY TO INSTALL: Your bag comes with everything you need to load it up, attach it, and hit the road in minutes! Includes carrier, (4) attachment straps, (4) Car Clips, and set up guide.
